content.body: so i realized while implementing is/toWellFormed that, while web engines today with 1-byte and 2-byte strings can make `isWellFormed` constant time trivially for 1-byte strings, optimizing for 2-byte strings is actually fairly involved

content.body: web engines today have a 1-bit encoding state: 1-byte or 2-byte
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: web engines today have a 1-bit encoding state: 1-byte or 2-byte

content.body: you now need 2-bits with 4 states: 1-byte, 2-byte-of-unknown-well-formedness, 2-byte-well-formed, 2-byte-ill-formed
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: you now need 2-bits with 4 states: 1-byte, 2-byte-of-unknown-well-formedness, 2-byte-well-formed, 2-byte-ill-formed

content.body: you have something of a combinatorial explosion by propagating that through to every string type (rope/cons, slice/view, etc)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: you have something of a combinatorial explosion by propagating that through to every string type (rope/cons, slice/view, etc)

content.body: you can compute it in sub-linear time for all the non-direct (i.e. don't own their own char buffer) string types, except for slices, which i don't know how to do
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: you can compute it in sub-linear time for all the non-direct (i.e. don't own their own char buffer) string types, except for slices, which i don't know how to do
